title: expert explanation needed
content: if you wanted to give someone five distinguishing characteristics to hgihlight the differences between Adobe Caslon and Adobe Garamond (other than the lower case g and a), what would they be?
author: willdean

comments.content:
The serifs on the uppercase T in Garamond (including Adobe) are very distinctive. They point in the same direction, instead of being symmetrical as in Caslons.

Adobe Caslon’s W (uppercase) comes to one peak, while Garamond’s looks like two overlapping Vs

Adobe Garamond has serifs both at the top and the bottom of the uppercase C while Adobe Caslon only has a top serif. However, other Caslons, such as 540, have both serifs.

The center bar on the E and F in Caslon don’t stick out as far as in Garamond.

Uppercase P has a closed counter in Caslon  
Uppercase G doesn’t have a nib in Caslon  
Uppercase Q has a longer more flourished tail in Caslon  
Uppercase S has different angles on the serifs (bottom is inward in Caslon)  
Lowercase j has a ball terminal in Caslon
